definition: to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)

sentences.english: An honest, hard-working man is the salt of the earth.
sentences.chinese: 誠實而勤勞的人是社會的中堅分子。

sentences.english: Wotif – is the dominant force in online travel in Australia.
sentences.chinese: Wotif是澳大利亞在線旅遊的中堅力量。

sentences.english: We had our two center backs suspended for that game.
sentences.chinese: 我們的兩個後防中堅在那場比賽中被停賽了。

sentences.english: This is the logic of the hard-core trader and momentum investor.
sentences.chinese: 這就是中堅交易員和動量投資者的邏輯。

sentences.english: An honest , hard-working man is the salt of the earth.
sentences.chinese: 誠實而勤勞的人才是社會的中堅分子。

sentences.english: The so-called Beijing school writers constitute the main force in the modern novel creation.
sentences.chinese: 所謂的京派作家構成了現代詩化小說創作的中堅力量。

sentences.english: Waters become the creative force and fueled a fascination with conceptual song cycles.
sentences.chinese: 沃特斯成爲創作中堅併爲概念歌曲組歌增添魔力。

sentences.english: Middle school students are mainstream and nucleus in the knowledge economic world in 21stcentury.
sentences.chinese: 當代中學生是21世紀知識經濟時代的主流與中堅。

sentences.english: They are the core force in cultivating cross-century talents.
sentences.chinese: 在培養跨世紀人才中，他們是中堅力量。

sentences.english: It motivates one to do his best in his career, and enables complete enjoyment in life.
sentences.chinese: 伴隨社會中堅在事業上全力以赴，在生活中全情投入。

sentences.english: They counted on the party stalwarts for support in the off-year campaigns.
sentences.chinese: 選情不利的一年，他們只能依靠該黨的中堅分子了。

sentences.english: Yoyo loves ramblers, himself being one of the chiefest.
sentences.chinese: 悠悠喜歡優遊自在的人，他自己就是個中的中堅。

sentences.english: Saturn's magnetosphere appears to be intermediate in nature to those of Earth and Jupiter.
sentences.chinese: 土星磁層的性質似乎是在中堅餑地球和木星的。

definition: to heal a wound/to recuperate (from an injury)
middle period of a tripartite provincial exam (in former times)/midfield/mid-court (in sports)/half-time/intermission half-way through a performance
(in classical literature) young military officer of high rank for his age/(during the Cultural Revolution) young militant in the Red Guard/(in modern usage) rising star (in sport, politics etc)
